How much you should charge for different journeys.
The basic requirements for drivers when carrying out private hire bookings.

questions.question: Can you inform members of the public that you are available for hire without a booking?
options: No, PHVs are not allowed to do so.
questions.answer: No, PHVs are not allowed to do so.

options: Yes, you should let the operator know about any changes

questions.question: Are PHV drivers allowed to pick up people from stations?
options: No, only Taxis (black cabs) are allowed to pick up from stations
Yes, but only if they have booked you through a licensed operator
Yes, but only if there are no Taxis (black cabs) outside the station
questions.answer: Yes, but only if they have booked you through a licensed operator

questions.question: What should you do at the end of each journey?
options: Remind passengers to make sure they have not left anything behind
Share your private number with the passenger
Check your vehicle for lost property
questions.answer: Remind passengers to make sure they have not left anything behind

questions.question: You must not encourage any member of the public to approach you or your PHV if they don’t have a valid booking. options: You must encourage any member of the public to travel with you
If someone does come up to you, you are allowed to hand out a business card with the number of your operator on it
You can pick a passenger up without a booking only on the street if they approach you
questions.answer: If someone does come up to you, you are allowed to hand out a business card with the number of your operator on it

questions.question: If while driving around anything seems different, unusual or doesn’t feel right, or you think that someone is acting suspiciously including someone you know or a passenger, you should:
options: Ignore it, don't waste police time
Report your concerns about suspicious activity to the confidential police anti-terrorist hotline on 0800 789 321
questions.answer: Report your concerns about suspicious activity to the confidential police anti-terrorist hotline on 0800 789 321

questions.question: If you approach people on the street outside a late-night venue to offer them private hire services, you may:
options: Get a better price than if booked through the operator
questions.answer: Be committing an offence

questions.question: Should you give out receipts to your passengers?

You are not required to give out receipts to passengers
You should check with your operator what the arrangements for giving out receipts are
questions.answer: You should check with your operator what the arrangements for giving out receipts are

questions.question: What to do if you're suspicious about any item left behind by a passenger?
options: Call the police immediately and follow their instructions
Throw it away on the street
Take it to your operator's office
questions.answer: Call the police immediately and follow their instructions

questions.question: Are PHVs the same thing as Taxis (black cabs)?
options: Yes, the only difference is the vehicles - but they have the same rights
Yes, the only differences are the vehicles and black cabs are also allowed to use bus lanes
questions.answer: No, PHVs are not Taxis

questions.question: Before the start of each journey, your operator is required to record certain information about the booking. Although you are not personally responsible for collecting or recording these details, you should know about this requirement and let your operator know about any changes. For example, tell your operator if the final destination changes.
options: No need to let your operator know about any changes
Although you are not personally responsible for collecting or recording these details, you should know about this requirement and let your operator know about any changes
It is the responsibility of the passenger to inform the operator of any changes
questions.answer: Although you are not personally responsible for collecting or recording these details, you should know about this requirement and let your operator know about any changes

questions.question: What are the main reasons to refuse to carry out a booking?
options: If the fare is too low
When you do not feel able or safe enough to take passengers
If the passengers are acting in a violent or offensive way
questions.answer: When you do not feel able or safe enough to take passengers

questions.question: At Heathrow & City Airport Taxi ranks you are:

Not allowed to use any taxi ranks - these are for licensed taxis only
Only allowed to pick up passengers safely
questions.answer: Not allowed to use any taxi ranks - these are for licensed taxis only

questions.question: You can only carry out bookings received from:
options: Anyone looking for a cab on the street or at stations or airports
questions.answer: London licensed PHV operator

questions.question: If you have any doubts about whether a journey outside Greater London (pickup or destination) is legal or not, you should:
questions.answer: Ask your operator

questions.question: To behave in an anti-social manner means:
options: To leave litter in the street and to go to the toilet in a public place
To sit in your vehicle with your engine off
questions.answer: To leave litter in the street and to go to the toilet in a public place

questions.question: You must not approach people on the pavement or outside a late night venue to offer them private hire services. If a customer approaches you, then you should tell them to contact a licensed private hire operator to make a booking.

You must not approach people on the pavement or outside a late night venue to offer them private hire services

questions.question: Are PHV drivers allowed to pick people up on the street?
options: No, unless they have booked you through a licensed operator
Yes, but only on the street outside your operator's centre
questions.answer: No, unless they have booked you through a licensed operator

questions.question: You should tell your operator as soon as your passenger:
options: Decides to change the destination of the journey
Asks you to pick up extra passengers or has extra luggage
questions.answer: Decides to change the destination of the journey

questions.question: What to do if you refused to carry out a booking?
options: Tell your operator the full reasons
Carry on and wait for another booking
Only inform the passenger about the reasons of refusal
questions.answer: Tell your operator the full reasons

questions.question: Are passengers allowed to enter your vehicle before you have received the booking from your operator?
options: Yes, but they must make a booking before you start the journey
Yes, but they must make a booking before arriving at their destination
No, you must not allow any passenger to enter your vehicle before you have received the booking from your operator
questions.answer: No, you must not allow any passenger to enter your vehicle before you have received the booking from your operator

questions.question: You should not wait in local car parks or residential streets. Remember that the taxi ranks at Heathrow Airport and London City Airport are for licensed taxis (black cabs) only.

questions.answer: Remember that the taxi ranks at Heathrow Airport and London City Airport are for licensed taxis (black cabs) only

questions.question: Are PHV drivers allowed to pick up people from airports?
options: Yes, airport pickups are exempt and do not require booking through an operator
Yes, but only if the person you are collecting has booked you directly by email, text or phone call
Yes, but only if they have booked you through a licensed operator
questions.answer: Yes, but only if they have booked you through a licensed operator

questions.question: If your passenger decides to change the destination of their journey, asks you to pick up extra passengers, or has extra luggage you should:
options: Stop your vehicle immediately and inform your operator
Tell your operator as soon as it is safe for you to do so
Charge the passenger extra without informing your operator

questions.question: Are you allowed to hand out your own business card or phone number to a member of the public that approaches you without a valid booking?

Yes, so that they could use your services in the future without having to book through a licensed operator
Yes, so that they could use your services in the future but first you will have to make a booking with your operator

questions.question: Your operator is responsible for:
options: Agreeing a fare for the journey with the passenger
Giving them an accurate estimate before a journey starts
questions.answer: Agreeing a fare for the journey with the passenger

questions.question: If you do refuse to carry out a booking, you should:
options: If a passenger is disrespectful, you should be much more harsh
questions.answer: Be polite and explain why
